comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Cavendish-Bentinck,_6th_Duk... An earlier portrait, in a rather fine uniform, is at www.horseracinghistory.co.uk/hrho/action/viewDocument?id=958 and www.nottshistory.org.uk/books/countypedigrees/portland1.htm More about the family and their estate at www.rotherhamweb.co.uk/h/welbeck.htm

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: In February 1915, the Duke of Portland was in the news query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9502E3DC1238E633A... "LONDON, Feb. 25. -- The Duke of Portland, who for thirty years has been one of the leading figures on the English turf, has caused to be canceled all his racing entries for the Epsom track, including those for the 1915 and 1916 Derby, because of the refusal of the Epsom Association to do without the use of its clubhouse for a few days. " The clubhouse was being used as a military hospital and the Duke reckoned that racegoers should be able to do without a clubhouse in the circumstances. also query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9A00E2DC1238E633A... "ENGLISH DERBY OFF.; Duke of Portland Cancels All Ascot Races for Two Years. LONDON, Eng., Feb. 25. -- There will be no races at the historic Epsom track for the next two years, as the result of the Duke of Portland canceling all the fixtures of the turf that were down for contest during 1915 and 1916. This means that among other big features the classic Derby will not be raced during that period."
